org.gridgain.grid
Interface GridNodeShadow

All Superinterfaces:
GridMetadataAware, Serializable
public interface GridNodeShadow
extends GridMetadataAware

When a grid node leaves the topology it leaves a shadow. A node shadow is a read-only snapshot of its last internal state. Node shadow is available on GridDiscoveryEvent when node leaves the topology.

id

Gets globally unique node ID.

Returns:

gridName

String gridName()
Gets grid name for the node.

Returns:
Grid name for the node.

isDaemon

boolean isDaemon()
Tests whether or not this node is a daemon.

Daemon nodes are the usual grid nodes that participate in topology but not visible on the main APIs, i.e. they are not part of any projections. The only way to see daemon nodes is to use this method.

Daemon nodes are used primarily for management and monitoring functionality that is build on GridGain and needs to participate in the topology but also needs to be excluded from "normal" topology so that it won't participate in task execution or data grid storage.

Returns:
true if this is a daemon node, false otherwise.

created

long created()
Gets the timestamp of when this shadow was created.

Returns:
Timestamp of creation.

lastMetrics

GridNodeMetrics lastMetrics()
Gets the last snapshot of the metrics for this shadow's node. Note that unlike the live node these metrics won't be updating and calling this method multiple times will result in the same value returned.

Returns:
Last snapshot of the metrics for this shadow's node.

attribute

<T> T attribute(String name)
Gets a node attribute.

Type Parameters:
T - Attribute Type.
Parameters:
name - Attribute name. Note that attribute names starting with org.gridgain are reserved for internal use.
Returns:
Attribute value or null.

attributes

Map<String,Object> attributes()
Gets all node attributes.

Returns:
All node attributes.

internalAddresses

Collection<String> internalAddresses()
Gets collection of IP addresses known internally on the same LAN.

In many managed environments like Amazon EC2 a virtual instance and therefore a GridGain node can have multiple internal and external IP addresses. Internal addresses are used to address the node from within this environment, while external addresses used to address this node from the outside of this environment.

Returns:
Collection of internal IP addresses. This collection is never null but can be empty.

externalAddresses

Collection<String> externalAddresses()
Gets collection of IP addresses known externally outside of this LAN.

In many managed environments like Amazon EC2 a virtual instance and therefore a GridGain node can have multiple internal and external IP addresses. Internal addresses are used to address the node from within this environment, while external addresses used to address this node from the outside of this environment.

Returns:
Collection of external IP addresses. This collection is never null but can be empty.

order

long order()
Node order within grid topology. Discovery SPIs that support node ordering will assign a proper order to each node and will guarantee that discovery event notifications for new nodes will come in proper order. All other SPIs not supporting ordering may choose to return node startup time here.

Returns:
Node startup order.
